result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael David Garrity

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:12 AM Defendant Michael David Garrity in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Michael David Garrity.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness, Officer Jerrod Steven Rankila, S/T. State-direct examination of witness. September 27, 2022/Loons Foot Marina, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Witness identifies Defendant, no response by Hoffman. Record reflects identification of Defendant. Continued testimony of items found in vehicle. 
Attorney Hoffman cross examines witness. State rests. 
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:30 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

11:15 AM Defendant Michael David Garrity in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Michael David Garrity.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State notes that notice was sent to Officer witness, witness had personal emergency and is unable to be here. State asks that bond be reduced by $250 cash and asks for additional 10 days to have preliminary hearing. Attorney Hoffman has no objection to bond reduction and resetting the hearing date.

Court reduces the bail to $250. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Prior: 8043 E Russell's Rd, Wascott, WI 54838
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:45 PM Defendant Michael David Garrity appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Chad LaLor appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint. 
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Pleads not guilty to misdemeanor charges. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requests 1000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Has a record with 10 failures to appear, most recent convictions are in MN, multiple probations revoked. Reviews prior convictions.
Attorney makes argument; local resident
Defendant indicates has a job interview coming up; has no ability to post cash.
Court orders $1000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.
